message: Afterward, Ren gets Mr. Haga, and he takes me inside to rest for a while.
Even though I lost the package he asked me to deliver, Mr. Haga just smiles and tells me to go home for the day.
I take him up on the offer.
Granny must not be home yet, as the house is still dark.
After flipping the lights on in the entryway, I head for the kitchen, grab my medicine off the shelf, and take a bigger dose than usual.
It really should be taken with food, but I need to get my headache under control.
Maybe I'm just relieved to be home, but it feels like my exhaustion has suddenly caught up with me. I can barely move.
Desperate to collapse into bed, I trudge up the stairs to my room.
I take Ren out of my bag and set him on the bed, then take off my jacket and lie down.
Phew...
I lost the package I was supposed to deliver and even ended up leaving work early...
I feel terrible, especially after the kindness Mr. Haga showed me.

name: 蒼葉
message: "What's going on with me?"
It's all because of that weird rabbit head guy.
...And Rhyme.
Is that what everyone's so worked up about?
I slowly sit up. Thinking about that virtual space is just making me feel worse.

My headache hasn't gone away. The medicine must not have kicked in yet.
Fortunately, I have just the thing for times like this.
I pick up my headphones from the pile with my jacket and put them on.
I select one of my favorite songs on my Coil, close my eyes, and let the music take me.
Music has always helped me relax whenever I'm feeling restless or unwell.
It's just me and the music. Everything else fades away.
Slowly, the music melds with my heartbeat. I feel myself drifting on the waves.
The melody whirls around me, softly caressing my body.
The sound soaks through my skin and into my blood, circulating gently through my veins.
Multi-colored lights flutter through the darkness, like delicate pieces of film.
It feels pleasant―comforting. This is a place for me alone, where no one else can trespass.
The discordant pain in my head and body grow distant as the peaceful sound spreads through me.
Faint sighs spill from my lips, almost like the music is pushing them from my lungs.
It feels so good... I'm in deeper than usual today. The world around me has ceased to exist.
If I can just fall asleep like this, I know I'll wake recharged and refreshed.
If I can just... fall asleep...
A sound?
I open my eyes slightly, but I'm still pretty out of it. I don't know what I heard.
...Well, whatever.
I close my eyes again.
This place...
I know it well.
I'm sitting on a sandy beach, talking to someone.
Someone whose words are more precious than gold... Words that seem to glitter in the sunlight.

...What did he say?
I can't remember.
I can't remember those precious words...
